meanings.definition: A fast car used for drag racing.
meanings.sent1: The dragster zoomed down the track at top speed.
meanings.sent2: I watched a dragster race at the track last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The dragster challenged the sports car to a race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a dragster, accelerating towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The bright red dragster left a trail of smoke behind as it raced ahead.

meanings.definition: A person who races in drag racing events.
meanings.sent1: The dragster prepared for the upcoming race with excitement.
meanings.sent2: She is a skilled dragster with many wins under her belt.
meanings.sent3: The dragster joked with the other racers before the competition.
meanings.sent4: His focus at work was like a dragster, always aiming for first place.
meanings.sent5: The experienced dragster knew the ins and outs of the racing world.

meanings.definition: To pull something along the ground.
meanings.sent1: I had to dragster the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: She will dragster the suitcase to the car before we leave.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to dragster the toy away from its owner.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to dragster on as we waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The old wagon was difficult to dragster up the hill.
